info.title: Genji Shimada API
info.description: REST API for Genji Shimada project.

get.description: Check if user is a creator.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Return a boolean indicating whether a user with the given ID exists.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

post.description: Create a placeholder user with an auto-generated ID and return the new user ID.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Fetch all users with their basic fields and aggregated Overwatch usernames.

post.description: Create a new user with the provided ID, nickname, and global name. If the user already exists, this is a no-op. Duplicate primary keys are reported with a 400.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Retrieve Overwatch usernames for a user. Responds with 404 if the user does not exist. Includes `username` and `is_primary` fields.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

put.description: Replace the Overwatch usernames for a user. This clears all existing entries and inserts the provided list. Use `is_primary` on exactly one entry to mark it as primary.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Fetch a single user by ID. Returns nickname, global name, coins, aggregated Overwatch usernames, and a `coalesced_name` preferring primary OW username, then nickname, then global name.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

patch.description: Update the global name and nickname for a user.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Compute per-difficulty completion counts and medal thresholds for the given user. Uses verified, latest-per-user runs and Global maps only.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

put.summary: Link fake member to real user
put.description: Reassign references from the fake user to the real user and delete the fake user row.

400.description: Bad request syntax or unsupported method

get.description: Count official, visible maps per base difficulty (stripping '+'/'-').
